Body: Sneak peek into the history of e-commerce  Did you know that American Airlines together with IBM took on developing a unique booking system for commercial airliners as early as in the 1950s? The SABRE system created back then has become the first business process that we have got used to calling e-commerce today. The SABRE system still exists – it has helped airliner passengers make sense of rates and flight schedules over the period of its existence. Today it is being used by 14 cruise liners, 25 car brands, 400 airline companies 100,000 hotels and over 350,000 tourism agencies all over the world!  Then, in 1971-72 MIT and Stanford AI lab students made use of the famous ARPANET computer network (developed by the US Ministry of Defense) for organizing sales deals between students.  Later, in 1979, Michael Aldrich, an English inventor created the first online shopping system that featured the simplest transactions between merchants and customers. Thanks to the advances in modern technology, the spread of the internet and the popularity of social media, the e-commerce market has picked up speed considerably over the recent couple of decades.  https://b.radikal.ru/b03/1806/22/ab16806e11f3.jpg
